Reviews.Title: “I love Berlin!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vladimir S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near U6 bahn station and that is very good. Food was exellent and staff is good. Only imperfection are that hotel located near airport and looks like plane crash in hotel wall :)) All other things are OK.

Reviews.Title: “£50 a night for an airport hotel in Berlin - works.”
Reviews.Author: JustMB
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy enough to find, parking was €8 per night. Clean room. The location itself is about 10 min drive from the airport. I can't comment in breakfast, €14 pp, as we didn't have that. There is an argentian steakhouse only 8 min walk away at Kurt Schmacher square. Great food and unbelievably good prices. Just one to be aware off. Please note the hotel is underneath the approach path to the airport. No flights after midnight but until then you will hear the planes coming in even with the window closed. Nothing to spoil your night though, each plan is through within 10 seconds and the airport is not THAT busy. All in all, good hotel, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: PallasParis
Reviews.Content: I was there in October 2011 for two days. The rooms are fine, clean, and quiet. I was travelling alone and for 65 Euros I had a double bed, a sufficiently large bathroom (with shower) and a large desk. The breakfast is expensive (14 Euros) but the buffet is diverse and rather complete, albeit lonely, very few people took it as there are lost of cafés and restaurants around. The tram stop is in front of the hotel and from the airport Tegel it takes about 45 minutes to get to the hotel. The hotel is basic but convenient.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel near TEGEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rob188636
Reviews.Content: super hotel for the travellers who go or arrive by plane in Tegel. Staff friendly and helful. Strange system of parking. Good food - nice idea of dinner buffet. Breakfast also OK. Many thanks to the waitress and kitchen staff for amusing our little son. Unfortunatelly we heart the noise from the airport - its good that the rush hour is 12-15:00! But on the other side - you have great opportunity to see so many planes so close to you - sometimes we had an idea that we can reach them just by rising the hand!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin, practical local”
Reviews.Author: nerudova
Reviews.Content: Sound proof windows block all the noise from the airport. Perfect location for getting in and out of Berlin. There's a supermarket around the corner and a metro stop on the next block.

Reviews.Title: “For departing from Tegel.”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Abraga
Reviews.Content: This place is very easy for departure from airport Tegel - opposite the entrance is stop bus to airport. Only 15-20 minutes, you arrive in terminal C. It is very good hotel for the money. Important: there is perfect restaurant with cheep price, if you go from U-Bahn "Afrikanishe Strasse", at right side in yard. Minus: so far from touristic center.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for a necessary night stay over”
Reviews.Author: Travelluxemb
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay close to the airport, in order to take an early flight. From 6 hr to 23hr great close view on landing airplanes with associated noicelevels. So close view that you keep yclosed your windows in a hot room without airco, and need to interrupt phone calls every 10 min when a plane lands, and explain to your counterparty that there was not a train passing through your room... Night is quiet to sleep. Carpet worn, in general the complete interior is up to a refreshment. Did not try the restaurant, as it did not look convincing. Breakfast has the larger choice, and is acceptable, just missed my "half skimmed milk" for the cereals... :(

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan on writing reports”
Reviews.Author: DrJVBM
Reviews.Content: Average airport hotel with smallish rooms. Yes planes are noticeable - use ear plugs if it bothers you. It's more like a truck going past than a plane. Room 421 has a good desk but no desk light and the room lights throw so little light onto it that typing at night is a penance (put your suitcase on the bed and your laptop on it and move a chair over and aim the bed head light at the laptop). You also need a good ten foot cord to plug your laptop in if using the desk in daylight. I liked the bed. However skimpy pillows and no spares supplied. No shuttle service to airport. If you have a lot of baggage you will have to use a taxi which will moan a lot about the Dorint being too close to make a taxi ride worthwhile. No minibar. Room safe does not work. Wouldn't really recommend it unless you can't do better. Try the Holiday Inn West Esplanade. Much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Tegel Airport, is a basic, clean, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Vita25
Reviews.Content: This is a basic, clean, no frills place, which, if you're on a budget and need to be at the airport by 5:30, can be a good deal. You can take the low, non-refundable advance price on their Web site. The frequent bus 128 to the airport stops at the door. Restaurant prices are high, but there are some alternatives cafes in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “I would find another hotel if I were you!!”
Reviews.Author: Hawker-Eye
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of the year and was very disappointed. Firstly the biggest point is that it is at the end of the runway at Tegel and landing planes are 150 to 200 ft above the hotel so there is a constant noise of landing planes. It is great if you wanted to see who makes the tyres on the Air berlin 737 but that is about it. The hotel needs a refurb, the beds are poor and facilities are poor and menu choice is poor. Poor in room entertainment. But the staff are friendly and welcoming. This is not the usual standard that you get from Dorint. If you are on a tight budget then it is ok, but if it was my bucks i would stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value !”
Reviews.Author: Casualist
Reviews.Content: Whilst it hardly sits comfortably with the high end luxury standards of many Dorint hotels, pricewise it can't be beaten, with rooms on a weekend at 35 EUR in October, breakfast not included. It may be way outside the centre, but its almost next door to a U-bahn station with trains every 10 minutes to the centre, a journey of less than 15 minutes. The station and area felt totally safe, even late at night. Its also just a couple of stops on the airport bus from Tegel. There are lots of snack kiosks (currywurst), ethnic restaurants (Turkish, Indian, Chinese) and fast food joints (Burger King) outside the station for dining. The hotel itself may be on the flight path to Tegel but I never heard the planes from my room, which although basic, was clean. Staff were wonderfully friendly. I'd much rather stay here for next to nothing and buy an all-day travelcard to commute to/from the centre, than stay in an expensive central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry about airplane noise; good budget option for airport.”
Reviews.Author: andersonxt
Reviews.Content: This is a basic, clean, no frills place, which, if you're on a budget and need to be at the airport by 6:00, can be a good deal--if you take the low, non-refundable advance price on their Web site. My room was on the top floor, yet the airplane noise (they do fly right overhead) was truly negligible. The safe in the room doesn't work (there's supposedly one at reception); the alarm you set on the TV does. The frequent bus to the airport (7 min.; tix from the driver) stops at the door. (Forget breakfast; buy a sandwich after security.) The subway, a safe 5-minute walk, has you downtown in 13.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: vivetsandys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a poor location, directly on the flight path to the airport with planes passing about 100 meters above the hotel almost constantly - unless you live on a flight path back home there is no possible way you would get a good night sleep or any quiet. Of course, sleep is a bit rough as the bed is not comfortable and pillows are terrible. The bathroom is not much better. The hotel is also located a good distance from anything worth going to in Berlin and there is nothing of substance in walking distance. With all these I would expect it to be a lower price - all in all it should have been better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, room was disgusting”
Reviews.Author: jplenny
Reviews.Content: As the name say, the Dorint Berlin Airport Tegel hotel implies, it is near the Tegel Airport. To be more precise, the hotel is about .25 miles from the end of the runway. While this would normally not be an issue with hotels that had adequate soundproofing, this hotel does not. The noise of the jets screaming directly overhead from 6:00am to late into the night makes it difficult to relax, get work done, or even get some rest during those hours. If you do stay here, remember to bring ear plugs! When it comes to the room, it was pretty disgusting. The bedding appeared clean and fresh, but the sofa was so stained and dirty, I was afraid to go near it. It looked like something from a crime scene. I've attached pictures so one doesn't think I'm exaggerating a bit. The room size was OK, but it has a rather weird layout. The bed wasn't parallel to the walls, but angled between the two. Look at the pictures to see what I am describing. To make matters worse, the desk area had no power outlets, which made using a laptop there a bit of an annoyance. The internet was very pricey at 24.95 Euro per 24 hours. Finally the neighborhood appeared to be mostly an industrial type area. At night it was very dark and didn't seem like a place you would want to be wandering around. The hotel rate was 90 Euro, which is a decent rate for Berlin. There are certainly better located, cleaner, similarly priced hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel, bad location - typical of Travelsphere tour”
Reviews.Author: normanjohnston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in May as part of worst ever Travelsphere tour. The hotel is adequate, but it is on the outskirts of Berlin. This tour was poorly pre-planned. It was impossible to carry out the tour in 20 days to an acceptable level. The expectations for the tour - driving quite long distances to enable a reasonable amount of sightseeing - were not achieved. The tour treated us as guinea pigs; in that this was the first time it had been included in the Travelsphere program. Problems included the following:- Clear lack of proper planning by Travelsphere Several poor quality hotels. Worst – Minsk Almost all hotels far outside town/city Too many stops/long stops giving not enough time in 1 night destinations Arrived Klaipeda and no food available even outside hotel Didn’t see Klaipeda at all, except hotel on outskirts Too little time in attractive destinations e.g. Gdansk, Warsaw Too Too much time in less attractive/important destinations e.g. Novgorod, Wroclaw Too many very late night arrivals Almost all stops had not been researched Many stops were at ‘stinking’ little toilets Out of 20 days 14 were transfer days - Average journey time almost 10 hours

HotelInfo.Name: Dorint Berlin Airport Tegel
HotelInfo.Address: Gotthardstrasse 96, 13403 Berlin, Germany
